definition: self-respect of old person/face/thick-skinned (i.e. impervious to criticism)/brazen

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: Once throne eyes gaze, age face a dark, remember the human into blacklist.
sentences.chinese: 皇帝眼睛一瞪，老脸一黑，就把人惦记入黑名单了。

sentences.english: Don't let anyone wearing a scowl come closer than a hundred paces.
sentences.chinese: 不要让任何拉着一副老脸的人接近你。

definition: to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
to give a hollow laugh/to force a smile/forced laugh/CL:聲|声[sheng1]
very red/red through and through/to blush (deep red)
